item.title: Roblox: Skillful Codes (December 2024)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Skillful Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes in Skillful
  • How to Get More Skillful Codes

Skillful is a Roblox game about soccer, but it's different from the usual simulators. In this game, each player can turn the tide of the match because there are many powerful abilities that look like they are taken from some anime title. This adds more interesting situations and variety to the gameplay.

You can get random skills by making spins. The best ones will require a lot of cash, so we recommend redeeming Skillful codes to get free rewards. You can find all working codes below.

Updated December 25, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: We do everything we can to keep this guide up to date. Below you will find an active code that can be used to receive game currency.

All Skillful Codes

Working Skillful Codes

  • thankyoufor60klikes - Enter this code to get cash. (NEW)

Expired Skillful Codes

  • thankyoufor20klikes - Enter this code to get 40k cash.
  • UPDATE2ISHERE - Enter this code to get 25k cash.
  • thankyoufor4mvisits - Enter this code to get 15,000 cash
  • thankyoufor5mvisits - Enter this code to get 15,000 cash
  • thankyoufor15klikes - Enter this code to get 20,000 cash.
  • fixesformobileandtabletusers - Enter this code to get 25k cash.
  • thankyoufor30kmembers - Enter this code to get 40k cash.
  • thankyoufor10kfavourites - Enter this code to get 20k cash.
  • thankyoufor3mvisits - Enter this code to get 30k cash.
  • thankyoufor10klikes - Enter this code to get 60k cash.
  • UPDATE1! - Enter this code to get 40k cash.
  • thankyoufor2mvisits - Enter this code to get 35k cash.
  • thankyoufor20kmembers - Enter this code to get 30k cash.
  • thankyoufor5kfavourites - Enter this code to get 10k cash.
  • thankyoufor1mvisits - Enter this code to get 10k cash.
  • thankyoufor10kmembers - Enter this code to get 10k cash.
  • thankyoufor5klikes - Enter this code to get 10k cash.
  • thankyoufor500kvisits - Enter this code to get 25k cash.
  • thankyoufor4klikes - Enter this code to get 25k cash.
  • sorryforshutdownagain - Enter this code to get 50k cash.
  • thankyoufor3klikes - Enter this code to get 50k cash.
  • thankyoufor2klikes - Enter this code to get 75,000 cash.
  • 1kplayers!!! - Enter this code to get 50,000 cash.
  • sorryforshutdown - Enter this code to get 30,000 cash.
  • thankyoufor1klikes - Enter this code to get 30,000 cash.
  • thankyoufor500likes - Enter this code to get 45,000 cash.
  • sorryfordelay! - Enter this code to get 17,500 cash.
  • release! - Enter this code to get 30,000 cash.

In Roblox games, you can often redeem codes and get rewards. In Skillful , you will get a lot of cash that you can spend on emotes or abilities. To get rare abilities, you need to make a lot of spins, so codes will come in handy regardless of whether you are a beginner or an experienced player.

How to Redeem Codes in Skillful

Codes in Roblox games are usually redeemed in the same way, so experienced players will quickly figure it out, even in a new game. Meanwhile, players who rarely play Roblox games may not understand how to redeem codes, even though it can be done quickly from the main menu. To help such players, we have created a guide explaining how to redeem codes in Skillful .

  • Open Roblox and launch Skillful .
  • In the main menu, go to Shop.
  • At the bottom of the screen, you will see a field labeled Input Code. Paste the code into it and press Enter on your keyboard. If the code is entered correctly, a message will appear in the field.

Remember, to get all the rewards, you need to redeem the codes as soon as possible before they expire.

How to Get More Skillful Codes

You'll get more Roblox codes if you bookmark this page in your browser, as it will be updated regularly. In most browsers, you can do this by pressing Ctrl + D. You can also find information about new codes on the developers' websites:

  • Skillful Discord server

item.title: Every Major Video Game Release Coming Soon For PS5 And PS4
item.description:
Quick Links

  • PS5 & PS4 Games Coming Out In December 2024
  • PS5 & PS4 Games Coming Out In January 2025
  • PS5 & PS4 Games Coming Out In February 2025
  • PS5 & PS4 Games Coming Out In March 2025
  • PS5 & PS4 Games Coming Out In April 2025
  • Major 2025 PS5 Games With No Release Dates
  • Major Upcoming PS5 Games With No Release Year

Sonyâ€™s PlayStation 5 has been around for a couple of years by this point, granting it plenty of opportunity to build up an expansive library capable of catering to the needs of most users. New PS5 games drop at an almost daily rate, ranging from smaller-scale indie projects designed by a handful of developers to massive AAA exclusives that are designed to be system sellers. In the meantime, the PlayStation 4 continues to receive love with cross-generation titles, so people who have yet to upgrade still have plenty to look forward to.

Which upcoming PS5 games will soon hit store shelves around the world? Which upcoming 2025 PS5 games will set the world alight? The calendar lists the most notable PS5 and PS4 projects, along with their North American release dates if that information has been announced.

Updated on December 25, 2024: For the last full week of 2024, the upcoming PlayStation 5 games were added to the calendar: The Legend of Cyber Cowboy, Boti: Byteland Overclocked, Disorder, Sword of the Necromancer: Resurrection, Atomic Heart: Enchantment Under the Sea, Ambulance Life: A Paramedic Simulator, Cypress Leg.

PS5 & PS4 Games Coming Out In December 2024

Marvel Rivals, Legacy Of Kain, & More

December tends to be one of the less exciting months since releases are primarily limited to the first two weeks. That said, 2024's edition has had a couple of noteworthy projects, most of which are free-to-play games. While hero shooters are starting to feel old by this point, Marvel Rivals is probably the month's biggest release, and it has gotten off to a pretty good start. Infinity Nikki is a great cozy open-world game with a focus on dress-up and exploration. Even UFL has something to offer anyone craving a soccer game alternative to EA Sports FC .

Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver has received a compilation remaster, which is great news, and The Thing Remastered is also a fun retread of a cult classic. Fairy Tail 2 is a fun turn-based JRPG, and Fantasia Neo Dimension might scratch a similar itch.

  • December 3 : Diesel Legacy: The Brazen Age (PS5, PS4)
  • December 4 : Lorelei and the Laser Eyes (PS5)
  • December 4 : The Thaumaturge (PS5)
  • December 4 : Warhammer 40,000: Darktide (PS5)
  • December 5 : A Plague Tale Collection (PS5)
  • December 5 : Entropy Survivors (PS5)
  • December 5 : Fantasia Neo Dimension (PS5, PS4)
  • December 5 : Infinity Nikki (PS5)
  • December 5 : Little Big Adventure: Twinsen's Quest (PS5)
  • December 5 : Love Too Easily (PS5)
  • December 5 : Railroads Online (PS5)
  • December 5 : Skydance's Behemoth (PS5)
  • December 5 : Stranger Things VR (PS5)
  • December 5 : Symphonia (PS5, PS4)
  • December 5 : The Thing Remastered (PS5, PS4)
  • December 5 : UFL (PS5)
  • December 5 : Uncle Chop's Rocket Shop (PS5)
  • December 5 : Under Defeat (PS5)
  • December 6 : Astebros (PS5)
  • December 6 : Demons of Asteborg (PS5)
  • December 6 : Dog Man: Mission Impawsible (PS5)
  • December 6 : Macross Shooting Insight (PS5, PS4)
  • December 6 : Marvel Rivals (PS5)
  • December 6 : Path of Exile 2 (PS5)
  • December 6 : Real Heroes: Firefighter HD (PS5)
  • December 6 : Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun - Aiko's Choice (PS5)
  • December 9 : Among Ashes (PS5)
  • December 9 : Road Maintenance Simulator 2 - Winter Services (PS5)
  • December 10 : Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver 1 & 2 Remastered (PS5, PS4)
  • December 10 : Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: Rita's Rewind (PS5, PS4)
  • December 12 : Besiege (PS5)
  • December 12 : For the King 2 (PS5)
  • December 12 : Mercenaries Saga: Rebirth & Lament (PS4)
  • December 13 : Fairy Tail 2 (PS5, PS4)
  • December 13 : The Gate of Firmament (PS5)
  • December 13 : Zombie Rollerz: Pinball Heroes (PS5)
  • December 17 : Botany Manor (PS5, PS4)
  • December 17 : Flint: Treasure of Oblivion (PS5)
  • December 18 : Masters of Light (PS5)
  • December 19 : 7DAYS HEROES (PS5)
  • December 19 : Alien: Rogue Incursion (PS5)
  • December 19 : Universe For Sale (PS5)
  • December 19 : Yeah! You Want "Those Games," Right? So Here You Go! Now, Let's See You Clear Them! 1+2 (PS5, PS4)

PS5 & PS4 Games Coming Out In January 2025

Sniper Elite, Dynasty Warriors, & More

While not usually one of the most packed months due to featuring a light opening two weeks, January tends to pick up steam as it goes along, and the 2025 addition seems to follow this trend. Admittedly, at the moment, very few huge games have been announced for the upcoming year's first few weeks, but there are still some exciting prospects.

Arken Age should be a fun VR option, while Freedom Wars Remastered will make a PS Vita exclusive available to a wider audience. Dynasty Warriors might have missed the mark with its ninth generation, but Origins will hopefully be a return to form. Tales of Graces f Remastered should have fantastic combat, assuming the original's system is mostly retained (and has aged well).

Sniper Elite: Resistance is currently set to end January 2025 on a relatively high note.

  • January 1 : The Legend of Cyber Cowboy (PS5, PS4)
  • January 2 : Neptunia Riders VS Dogoos (PS5, PS4)
  • January 2 : Wuthering Waves (PS5)
  • January 6 : Project Tower (PS5)
  • January 7 : Ys Memoire: The Oath in Felghana (PS5, PS4)
  • January 9 : Crowd Run (PS5, PS4)
  • January 10 : Boti: Byteland Overclocked (PS5)
  • January 10 : Freedom Wars Remastered (PS5, PS4)
  • January 10 : Lost Ruins (PS5)
  • January 16 : Arken Age (PS5)
  • January 16 : Being Stronger While Playing! SilverStar Go DX (PS5)
  • January 16 : DreadOut: Remastered Collection (PS5, Switch)
  • January 16 : Morkull Ragast's Rage (PS5)
  • January 16 : Things Too Ugly (PS5)
  • January 17 : Dynasty Warriors: Origins (PS5)
  • January 17 : Tales of Graces f Remastered (PS5, PS4)
  • January 21 : RoboDunk (PS5)
  • January 22 : Disorder (PS5)
  • January 22 : ENDER MAGNOLIA: Bloom in the Mist (PS5, PS4)
  • January 23 : Star Wars Episode I: Jedi Power Battles Remaster (PS5, PS4)
  • January 23 : Sword of the Necromancer: Resurrection (PS5, PS4)
  • January 23 : Synduality: Echo of Ada (PS5)
  • January 28 : Cuisineer (PS5, PS4)
  • January 28 : Atomic Heart: Enchantment Under the Sea (PS5, PS4)
  • January 28 : Eternal Strands (PS5)
  • January 28 : The Stone of Madness (PS5)
  • January 28 : Tails of Iron 2: Whiskers of Winter (PS5, PS4)
  • January 30 : Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero (PS5, PS4)
  • January 30 : Sniper Elite: Resistance (PS5, PS4)
  • January 31 : Citizen Sleeper 2: Starward Vector (PS5)

PS5 & PS4 Games Coming Out In February 2025

Kingdom Come: Deliverance, Civilization, Assassin's Creed, Monster Hunter, & More

January should start 2025 off on a positive note, setting the stage for a packed February that could prove to be the year's strongest month. Nearly every week seems to have notable releases, and quite a few of them should be time-sinks that could stick around for years. Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 will build on its predecessor's realism to provide an immersive action RPG set in a Medieval open-world. If someone prefers a trip to Japan, they can check out Assassin's Creed Shadows , which will hopefully overcome a turbulent pre-release cycle and be a solid game.

Civilization 7 has been a long time coming, and if done right, it should be one of the best and most popular releases of 2025. The same can be said for Monster Hunter Wilds , and Capcom's project looks fantastic so far. The franchise has gone fully mainstream by this point, and Wilds could be its crowning achievement. Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii looks awesome and weird. Lara Croft will make her return in a compilation remastering three of the more polarizing adventures in her history.

  • February : Dragonkin: The Banished (PS5)
  • February 4 : Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 (PS5)
  • February 4 : Rogue Waters (PS5)
  • February 6 : Ambulance Life: A Paramedic Simulator (PS5)
  • February 6 : Moons of Darsalon (PS5, PS4)
  • February 11 : Sid Meier's Civilization 7 (PS5, PS4)
  • February 13 : Phantom Breaker: Battle Grounds Ultimate (PS5, PS4)
  • February 13 : Urban Myth Dissolution Center (PS5)
  • February 14 : Assassin's Creed Shadows (PS5)
  • February 14 : Date Everything (PS5)
  • February 14 : The Legend of Heroes: Trails through Daybreak 2 (PS5, PS4)
  • February 14 : Tomb Raider 4-6 Remastered (PS5, PS4)
  • February 18 : Lost Records: Bloom and Rage Tape 1 (PS5)
  • February 20 : Stories from Sol: The Gun-Dog (PS5, PS4)
  • February 21 : Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii (PS5, PS4)
  • February 21 : RPG Maker WITH (PS5)
  • February 27 : Cladun X3 (PS5, PS4)
  • February 27 : Crystar (PS5)
  • February 28 : Dollhouse: Behind The Broken Mirror (PS5)
  • February 28 : Dwerve (PS5)
  • February 28 : Monster Hunter Wilds (PS5)

PS5 & PS4 Games Coming Out In March 2025

Two Point Museum, Tales Of The Shire, & More

While very much a work in progress, March 2025 is starting to take shape, with several relatively big (but niche) PS5 titles slotting into the month. Two Point Museum will hopefully build on the success of Two Point Hospital and Two Point Campus , providing a wacky but detailed management sim that is accessible but also deep. Suikoden 1 & 2 HD Remaster should make two classic JRPGs available to a modern audience; meanwhile, people craving a full-blown new entry in the genre should keep an eye on Atelier Yumia . While intense battles are always a blast, sometimes nothing hits the spot like a relaxing escape from reality. Tales of the Shire could offer that.

  • March 2025 : Football Manager 25 (PS5)
  • March 4 : Two Point Museum (PS5)
  • March 6 : Ever 17 - The Out of Infinity (PS4)
  • March 6 : Never 7 - The End of Infinity (PS4)
  • March 6 : Split Fiction (PS5)
  • March 6 : Suikoden 1 & 2 HD Remaster (PS5, PS4)
  • March 6 : Venus Vacation PRISM - DEAD OR ALIVE Xtreme - (PS5, PS4)
  • March 10 : Warside (PS5, PS4)
  • March 11 : Wanderstop (PS5)
  • March 13 : Beyond The Ice Palace 2 (PS5, PS4)
  • March 13 : Bionic Bay (PS5)
  • March 18 : Lost Records: Bloom and Rage Tape 2 (PS5)
  • March 21 : Atelier Yumia: The Alchemist of Memories & the Envisioned Land (PS5, PS4)
  • March 21 : Bleach: Rebirth of Souls (PS5, PS4)
  • March 24 : Cypress Legacy (PS5)
  • March 25 : Tales of the Shire: A Lord of The Rings Game (PS5, PS4)
  • March 27 : AI Limit (PS5)
  • March 27 : Atomfall (PS5, PS4)
  • March 27 : Care Bears: Unlock the Magic (PS5, PS4)
  • March 27 : The First Berserker: Khazan (PS5)
  • March 27 : Gal Guardians: Servants of the Dark (PS5, PS4)
  • March 27 : Hitman: World of Assassination VR (PS5)
  • March 27 : Winning Post 10 2025 (PS5, PS4)

PS5 & PS4 Games Coming Out In April 2025

Fatal Fury & More

Honestly, April 2025 is still mostly a blank slate, with only a small handful of upcoming PS5 games declared for the month. Still, Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves should be one of the year's best fighting games, and the available footage has been exciting.

  • April 9 : All in Abyss: Judge the Fake (PS5)
  • April 10 : Memories Off Sousou: Not Always True (PS5)
  • April 17 : Mandragora (PS5)
  • April 24 : Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves (PS5)
  • April 24 : Yasha: Legends of the Demon Blade (PS5, PS4)

Major 2025 PS5 Games With No Release Dates

Borderlands, Ghost Of Yotei, & More

At this stage, the 2025 video game calendar still has a long way to go, and there is a chance that the year's biggest releases have yet to be announced. That said, several massive projects have tentatively declared plans to launch within 2025, although they have not committed to specific dates. GTA 6 , Death Stranding 2 , Borderlands 4 , Doom: The Dark Ages , Mafia: The Old Country , and Pathologic 3 are just a handful of sequels/prequels that seem likely to launch by the end of the year, and they all could be phenomenal.

  • May 2025 : Revenge of the Savage Planet (PS5, PS4)

Major Upcoming PS5 Games With No Release Year

Snake Eater, Wolverine, & More

As games spend years in development, plenty of projects are known to be in the works but have yet to announce anything resembling a release year. Wolverine , Assassin's Creed Infinity , Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater , Phantom Blade 0 , The Witcher continuation, and Beyond Good and Evil 2 are some of the biggest games in the works, all of which will attract plenty of attention once they debut. Most of these titles are presumably a few years away.

item.title: Stardew Valley Mod Adds a Jail to the Game
item.description:
Summary

  • A new Stardew Valley mod "Law and Order: Stardew Valley" adds two romanceable NPCs and allows players to send Pierre to jail.
  • The mod also introduces new fences and recipes, and is compatible with the popular "Stardew Valley: Expanded" mod.
  • The Stardew Valley community has created various mods to enhance the gaming experience, such as adding seasonal outfits and new areas.

A new Stardew Valley mod adds a jail to Pelican Town, introducing two new NPCs, and even a storyline of sending a villager to prison. Stardew Valley is full of excellent mods, and this one stands out due to the fresh ideas of its creator.

Originally released in 2016, Stardew Valley is essentially the most popular farming simulator ever made. Due to a mixture of addictive gameplay and a charming, cozy atmosphere, the game has sold over 41 million copies so far, according to its creator Eric â€œConcernedApeâ€ Barone. Over the years, Stardew Valley has received many updates, and gamers have created excellent mods for it.

Now, a Stardew Valley modder called sdvhead created â€œLaw and Order: Stardew Valley,â€ a mod that adds a new sheriffâ€™s office and jail to Pelican Town, which becomes available after the Summer Luau event in the gameâ€™s first year. â€œLaw and Order: SVâ€ can be downloaded from Nexus Mods, and adds a new building that houses a town jail, interview room, and a shop counter offering goods to fund the department. As part of the new content, gamers will get to know and maybe even romance two new characters: Sheriff Russel and Officer Shannon. Another interesting storyline added in the mod is being able to send Pierre to jail. As Stardew Valley players may know, Pierre often takes credit for the farmerâ€™s high-quality crops, and this mod gives them a chance to get revenge.

Law and Order: Stardew Valley Mod's Main Features

  • Two new romanceable NPCs.
  • New fences, recipes, and special orders.
  • Being able to send Pierre to jail.
  • Compatible with the popular Stardew Valley: Expanded mod.

The mod also comes with unique unlockable cooking and crafting recipes, including the highly durable Velvet Rope Fence and the Security Fence. Gamers will be glad to know that Law and Order: SV is fully compatible with â€œStardew Valley: Expanded,â€ which is one of the most popular Stardew Valley mods ever released, so no scheduling and festival conflicts will happen to gamers using both projects. Gamers should be aware, however, that the jail mod makes major changes to Pierreâ€™s schedule, so it may not be compatible with other Pierre-specific mods.

After eight years of existence, the Stardew Valley community has created many amazing mods. Apart from this one, other excellent Stardew Valley mods often downloaded by the fanbase include ones that add seasonal outfits to major characters, introduce whole new areas such as the popular Ridgeside Village, change the UI, and more. With the help of these projects, gamers can easily tweak their experience to make Stardew Valley interesting for them for longer periods.

item.title: One Possible Switch 2 Launch Title is a No-Brainer
item.description:
Only 7 months have passed since Nintendo officially gave a reveal window for the successor to the Nintendo Switch , but for fans of the brand, it's felt like an eternity. Rumors about the as-of-yet unannounced console have been leaking out from all corners of the internet these past few months, from both trustworthy and questionable sources. At this point, it seems like practically every morsel of information about the Switch 2 has leaked online, including its specs, dimensions, and even controllers. In spite of all this commotion, Nintendo has remained oddly silent about the Switch's successor, and has given little-to-no information about what fans should expect from it.

Much of the discussion regarding the Switch 2 has centered around its launch date. Since the Switch 2 is supposed to be announced sometime before March 31, 2025, many have speculated that the console will be revealed in early January and released during the summer. Others have even suggested that Nintendo's next system will be launched as early as March. Regardless of when exactly the Switch 2 hits store shelves, though, it will likely have a pretty extensive lineup of games upon its release, including those from third-party developers. One of the games that would be a perfect fit as a launch title for the console is Genshin Impact .

Genshin Impact Should Be a Launch Title for the Switch 2

Genshin Impact is a Zelda-Inspired Gacha RPG from HoYoverse

Genshin Impact is one of the few AAA games out there that needs no introduction. This HoYoverse-developed gacha RPG had somewhat of a humble beginning, but it eventually evolved into a multibilllion dollar media giant in a relatively short timeframe. Just a few years after its release on PlayStation 4, PC, and iOS/Android in 2020, the game generated an astounding $3.9 billion in revenue on all platforms. Genshin Impact 's unprecedented success popularized the gacha game genre worldwide, which, for the most part, had previously been niche outside of Asian territories.

Although Genshin Impact is often cited as an inspiration for many video games these days, some may forget that Genshin Impact itself is heavily inspired by Nintendo's The Legend of Zelda series. Indeed, when HoYoverse's action RPG was first shown off at the ChinaJoy expo in 2019, many gamers accused it of being a blatant Breath of the Wild copycat, due to its similar-looking open world and gliding mechanics. Ultimately, Genshin Impact ended up being very distinct from BOTW in terms of gameplay and tone, but it did still adopt some of that Zelda charm.

Genshin Impact Launching on Switch 2 Day-One Could Make Up for Its Long-Delayed Switch Port

Considering how much inspiration it takes from a classic Nintendo franchise, it's somewhat surprising that Genshin Impact isn't available on a Nintendo console. Although the game was announced for the Switch in January 2020 (months before it had even been released), the port is still nowhere in sight. In the years that have passed since then, Genshin Impact has been brought to both the PlayStation 5 and the Xbox Series X/S, with no word of a Switch release. HoYoverse did publicly state in 2022 that the Nintendo Switch version of the game was still in development, but given the company's silence on the matter and the imminent launch of the Switch 2, it wouldn't be surprising to hear that it has been canceled.

Genshin Impact may be playable on mobile phones, but it's still a surprisingly demanding game, and because of that, the Switch may not be powerful enough to handle it. As such, the Switch 2 seems like the perfect home for HoYoverse's hit action RPG. Since Nintendo's next console will be more graphically capable than its predecessor, it's highly probable that it will be able to run a game like Genshin Impact with ease. If HoYoverse does decide to bring the game to the Switch 2, though, it should aim to release it as a launch title for the system. Nintendo fans have already waited long enough to get their hands on Genshin Impact , so a day-and-date release on the Switch 's successor would be the perfect way to make it up to them.

item.title: Gamers Want These 4 'Dead' Single-Player Franchises to Make a Comeback
item.description:
Summary

  • Gamers want Manhunt, Prototype, Infamous, and The Darkness to make comebacks.
  • No plans for new games, remasters, or remakes have been announced.
  • But there's always a chance they could be revived at some point down the line.

Gamers have picked Manhunt , Prototype , Infamous , and The Darkness as four single-player gaming franchises that they want to see make a comeback. As the years go by, some gaming franchises inevitably fall by the wayside, but that doesn't mean that there isn't a group of dedicated fans that would love to see them make a comeback.

Sometimes long dormant franchises are brought back from the dead through remasters or remakes. Other times, publishers shock the world with the reveal of an unexpected sequel, like the announcement of Okami 2 at The Game Awards 2024. There's always a chance dormant franchises will one day make a comeback, and that is the hope that gamers have for the aforementioned four single-player franchises in particular.

A Reddit post by user Crylose named Manhunt , Prototype , Infamous , and The Darkness as four single-player franchises they want to see make a comeback. The post described the franchises as "dead" and "long forgotten," but if the response to it is any indication, these games certainly have not been forgotten. The post generated over 18,000 upvotes, nearly 2,000 comments, and two awards, with many agreeing that the listed series need to return.

Gamers Pick Single-Player Franchises That Should Make a Comeback

While there is clearly some fan demand for these particular single-player franchises to make a comeback, nothing has been announced at the time of this writing. Manhunt , a stealth horror series from Rockstar Games, has been on ice since 2007's Manhunt 2 , a new Prototype game hasn't been released since 2012's Prototype 2 , the last Infamous game came out in 2014, and there hasn't been a new Darkness game since 2012. There could be licensing issues preventing The Darkness 3 from happening, so it seems like the least likely to get a sequel out of the four franchises listed.

The other three franchises seem more realistic. The Prototype IP should now be under the Xbox umbrella, and so there's always a chance the company could give it to one of its many studios. A new Manhunt game could be a smaller scale project for Rockstar Games to help fill the gap between GTA 6 and whatever its next project is, though fans shouldn't hold their breath for that to happen. As for Infamous , Sony has already shown a willingness to let other studios tackle Sucker Punch franchises, so that could happen again. Alternatively, Sucker Punch could eventually decide to return to the Infamous universe itself as its next project after 2025's Ghost of Yotei . As it stands, no new entries in any of the highlighted franchises have been announced as of December 2024.
